definition: army worm (e.g. Mythimna separata or Leucania separata etc, major cereal pests)
to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Fall Armyworms are also difficult to control using pesticides.
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂也很难控制伪粘虫。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a method for improving pest trapping and killing capacity of a sticky trap.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了一种提高粘虫板诱集杀虫能力的方法。

sentences.english: Nonnative Armyworms are now spreading rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 这种非本土的伪粘虫现在快速蔓延。

definition: boring insect/snout moth's larva (Aphomia gullaris or Plodia interpuncuella or Heliothus armigera etc), major agricultural pest
boring insect/snout moth's larva (Aphomia gullaris or Plodia interpuncuella or Heliothus armigera etc), major agricultural pest
imago (adult, sexually mature insect, the final stage of its development)
insect damage/destruction of crops by pest insects
